detaileddescription.para: If the proposed new position exits the domain (strict inequality: lo < x < hi), the entire displacement is zeroed and the particle stays at its current position. This is a rejection scheme, not a bounce/reflection scheme.

briefdescription.para: Wrap-around: position wraps modulo domain length.

detaileddescription.para: Both lo and hi faces of the axis must be set to Periodic. A wrap counter (int32_t) tracks net domain crossings. Wrapped domain is [lo, hi).

simplesect.para: Requires status/wrap arrays to be allocated (via ensure_tracking_arrays() or prepare()) for wrap counting.

briefdescription.para: Allow exit: particle flagged as Exited.

detaileddescription.para: If the new position exits the domain, the particle retains its current position and is marked ParticleStatus::Exited. Exited particles are skipped in subsequent step() calls.

simplesect.para: Requires status array to be allocated (auto-allocated by prepare() / ensure_tracking_arrays()).

briefdescription.para: Boundary condition type for a single axis.

detaileddescription.para: Applied per-face (lo/hi) via AxisBoundary. See boundary.hpp for full config.

simplesect.para: AxisBoundary, BoundaryConfig

detaileddescription.para: Controls how velocity is sampled at particle positions.

simplesect.para: Legacy PAR² uses Linear interpolation ALWAYS. The YAML "interpolation" field in legacy configs controls the DRIFT mode, not velocity interpolation.

briefdescription.para: No drift correction (only valid if dispersion is zero)
Use precomputed cell-centered div(D) field (legacy: "finite difference")
Compute div(D) on-the-fly via trilinear derivatives (legacy: "trilinear")

detaileddescription.para: The drift correction term (div(D)) arises from the Fokker-Planck equation and compensates for the spatial variation of the dispersion tensor D. Without this term, particles would accumulate in low-dispersion regions.

para.bold: The dispersion tensor D is defined as:

sect3.title: None
sect3.para: No drift correction. Only valid when dispersion parameters are zero.

sect3.title: Precomputed (legacy: "finite difference")
sect3.para:
Computes div(D) once per timestep at cell centers using finite differences:
Central differences in interior cells: (D[i+1] - D[i-1]) / (2·dx)
One-sided differences at boundaries: (D[i+1] - D[i]) / dx or (D[i] - D[i-1]) / dx
Advantages: Can be computed once if velocity is steady. Storage: Requires 3×num_cells floats for drift + 6×num_cells for D tensor.

sect3.title: TrilinearOnFly (legacy: "trilinear")
sect3.para: Computes div(D) at each particle position using trilinear derivatives of corner velocities. This is the default legacy PAR² mode.
The implementation samples 8 corner velocities and uses their analytical trilinear derivatives to compute ∂D/∂x, ∂D/∂y, ∂D/∂z.
Advantages: No precomputation, works with time-varying velocity. Cost: ~8 corner velocity reads + math per particle per step.

simplesect.para: Legacy PAR² always uses Linear velocity interpolation.
cornerfield::velocityCorrection() for TrilinearOnFly implementation
launch_compute_drift_precomputed() for Precomputed implementation

detaileddescription.para: The name VelocityView is kept for backwards compatibility. New code should prefer FaceFieldView for clarity.

parameterdescription.para: Number of cells in each direction

memberdef.name: make_uniform_grid

briefdescription.para: Create a uniform grid with same cell size in all directions.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ParticlesView< T > &particles, T x0, T y0, T z0, T x1, T y1, T z1, unsigned long long seed=12345ULL, cudaStream_t stream=nullptr)
memberdef.name: inject_box

briefdescription.para: Initialize particles uniformly distributed in a box.

detaileddescription.para:
T
Floating point type (float or double)
particles
Particle view (device pointers)
x0 y0 z0
Minimum corner of box
x1 y1 z1
Maximum corner of box
seed
Random seed for reproducibility
stream
CUDA stream (nullptr for default)
Particles are distributed uniformly within the box using a deterministic algorithm based on particle index and seed.

simplesect.para: This is the standalone function version. TransportEngine::inject_box provides the same functionality through the engine API.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ParticlesView< T > &particles, T x0, T y0, T z0, T x1, T y1, T z1, int nx, int ny, int nz, cudaStream_t stream=nullptr)
memberdef.name: inject_grid

briefdescription.para: Initialize particles at regular grid positions within a box.

detaileddescription.para:
T
Floating point type
particles
Particle view
x0 y0 z0
Minimum corner
x1 y1 z1
Maximum corner
nx ny nz
Number of particles per axis
stream
CUDA stream
Creates a regular grid of particles. Total particles = nx * ny * nz. If particles.n != nx*ny*nz, only min(particles.n, nx*ny*nz) are set.

simplesect.para: Useful for debugging and visualization.

memberdef.name: concentration_box

briefdescription.para: Count particles in a box region.

simplesect.para: Fraction of particles inside box [0.0, 1.0]
This function SYNCHRONIZES the stream internally.
This blocks the CPU until the stream completes. Unsuitable for the hot path in HPC pipelines. For async operation, use StatsComputer.
Particles with any status are counted (no filtering). This matches legacy behavior.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ConstParticlesView< T > &particles, int axis, T threshold, cudaStream_t stream=nullptr)

simplesect.para: Fraction of particles with coord > threshold [0.0, 1.0]
This function SYNCHRONIZES the stream internally.
This blocks the CPU until the stream completes. Unsuitable for the hot path in HPC pipelines.
All particles counted regardless of status (legacy behavior).
ParticleCounts with active/exited/inactive counts
If particles.status is nullptr, all are counted as active.
This function SYNCHRONIZES the stream internally.

memberdef.argsstring: (int ix, int iy, int iz, int nx, int ny) noexcept
memberdef.name: merge_id

briefdescription.para: Compute the merged linear index for a 3D point in legacy layout.

detaileddescription.para:
ix
X index (0 to nx inclusive)
iy
Y index (0 to ny inclusive)
iz
Z index (0 to nz inclusive)
nx
Number of cells in X
ny
Number of cells in Y
Linear index for arrays of size (nx+1)*(ny+1)*(nz+1)
This matches legacy PAR² facefield::mergeId(): index=iz*(ny+1)*(nx+1)+iy*(nx+1)+ix
